summary: This document appears to be an internal financial communication regarding funding for an account (79F) within the Federal Bureau of Prisons, specifically mentioning FCI Ft. Dix and Joint Base MDL. It shows a request for a YREG number and discussion about funding sources and cost centers.

persons.name: Financial Program Specialist FCI Ft. Dix
persons.context: The specialist is involved in a financial discussion about funding an account (79F) and mentions being out for the next few weeks.

persons.name: Accounting Tech
persons.context: The accounting tech requests a YREG number for a transaction related to MCC (likely Metropolitan Correctional Center) and expresses uncertainty about who to ask.

events.title: Financial funding request discussion
events.description: Internal communication about funding for account 79F, involving a request for a YREG number and questions about the funding source (P-1) and cost center.
personsInvolved: Financial Program Specialist FCI Ft. Dix

keyFacts: The document is a financial record from the U.S. Department of Justice Bureau of Prisons dated August 6, 2019.
It discusses funding for account 79F, which had an available balance of $4,243.83, and questions whether it should be funded from 'P-1'.
An Accounting Technician requests a YREG number for a transaction related to MCC (Metropolitan Correctional Center).
The communication involves staff from FCI Ft. Dix, NJ and Joint Base MDL, NJ.
The document shows internal bureaucratic processes for financial transactions within the Bureau of Prisons.
